noun.description: The process of taking in and fully understanding information or ideas.
examples: the assimilation of the knowledge of the Greeks

noun.description: The absorption and digestion of food or nutrients by the body or any biological system.
examples: nitrate assimilation usually takes place in leaves

noun.description: The process of becoming similar to something.
examples: Watson was ready to work for the assimilation of Scots law to English law where he thought it was justified
